arDJ5hZEgBtCmmrVzEZWjub9769eD686jmzb2XpSU1cM"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/cryptography/Hashes.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8cbd338f083224b4b6f0ff42cbda641a0a6c31ffcdca197452b97fe4d0918269","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f517dec5ba0c6491395acbf7f1d621f4e89e8f218bf5303c867b1c5ad70c6b11","dweb:/ipfs/QmWmXHRLEw8W6ckth7NyYTU88YfvuS7xSsfae5ksL8qNUe"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/cryptography/MerkleProof.sol":{"keccak256":"0x36a0c409c437a753cac9b92b75f93b0fbe92803bf2c8ff1517e54b247f166134","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://0f91ba472de411aa557cdbf6560c40750d87bd11c9060bc04d2ba7119af9d5a6","dweb:/ipfs/QmQjtYo2i7dDvzCEzZ67bDoNSG4RrwMoxPWuqFmX5Xzpuw"]},"src/TradeVerifier.sol":{"keccak256":"0x606486a8693f8151394f8cbac2b363b404b129f1a624545f998c30167fd2706e","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3b60a3c6993888d0a623dbde3c2dd7a25b87df1d18dc42a5c4314f4bf8fe408f","dweb:/ipfs/QmVJcHq41VBogJvXEZ4Bi5wEAaU2zqWQWHxAzLk1ASyyxZ"]}},"version":1}

batchVerify(bytes32[]).details: Skips zero-hashes and already-verified hashes silently.      Only counts hashes that were actually stored.

getStats().details: lastTimestamp is the block.timestamp of the most recent verifyTrade call,      NOT the current block timestamp (which was the original bug).

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.root: Root of the Merkle tree built from double-hashed trade hashes.                    Leaf format: keccak256(bytes.concat(keccak256(abi.encode(tradeHash))))                    This double-hash prevents second-preimage attacks.
params.tradeCount: Number of leaves (trades) in the tree.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

verifyMerkleProof(bytes32,bytes32[],byte.details: Leaf is double-hashed: keccak256(bytes.concat(keccak256(abi.encode(tradeHash))))         This matches OpenZeppelin's MerkleProof library expectation and prevents         second-preimage attacks where an attacker crafts an internal node == a valid leaf.

params.proof: Sibling hashes path from leaf to root (generated off-chain).
params.root: The Merkle root to check against (must exist on-chain).
params.tradeHash: The raw trade hash whose inclusion you want to prove.

returns._0: true if the proof is valid.

params.tradeHash: keccak256(abi.encode(symbol, price, qty, side, trader, timestamp))

batchVerify(bytes32[]).notice: Verifies multiple trade hashes in a single transaction.

getMerkleRoot(bytes32).notice: Returns metadata for a specific root.

getTradeCount(address).notice: Returns the number of trades a user has verified.

getTradeProof(bytes32).notice: Returns the full proof struct for a trade hash.

getUserTrades(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Get a paginated slice of a user's verified trade hashes.

revokeTrade(bytes32).notice: Owner can revoke a fraudulent/erroneous trade proof.

submitMerkleRoot(bytes32,uint256,string).notice: Commits a Merkle root representing a batch of N trades.         Storing one root is O(1) storage regardless of batch size.

verifyMerkleMultiProof(bytes32,bytes32[].notice: Multi-proof variant: verify multiple leaves against the same root in one call.         Gas-efficient when checking several trades from the same batch.

verifyMerkleProof(bytes32,bytes32[],byte.notice: Verifies that a trade hash is included in a previously submitted Merkle batch.

verifyTrade(bytes32).notice: Verifies a single trade hash and stores its proof on-chain.
